Un grand avantage pour les participants au projet est également qu'ils sont formés dans le domaine des finances et qu'ils ont la possibilité d'épargner dans des groupes d'épargne et de prêt créés en commun, afin d'utiliser cet argent pour payer par exemple les frais de scolarité des enfants ou pour acheter des semences.

agencyname: Swiss Agency for Development and Co-operation
projecttitle: Uzbekistan: Water Management Skills Development Project
project_descrip: Short: UZBEKISTAN: WATER MANAGEMENT SKILLS DEVELOPMENT PROJECT Long: The development of the Water and Education Sectors are a priority for Uzbekistan. The outdated infrastructure and equipment currently in use in irrigation, as well as in water supply, require skilled workers for operation, upgrading, maintenance and repair. Thousands of trained skilled workers are required to match the increased market demand in such professions. The project contributes to the national reform of the Vocational Education Training system and to the building of a modern, competency based and labor market oriented Vocational Education Training system, with focus on practical training.
shortdescription: UZBEKISTAN: WATER MANAGEMENT SKILLS DEVELOPMENT PROJECT
longdescription: The development of the Water and Education Sectors are a priority for Uzbekistan. The outdated infrastructure and equipment currently in use in irrigation, as well as in water supply, require skilled workers for operation, upgrading, maintenance and repair. Thousands of trained skilled workers are required to match the increased market demand in such professions. The project contributes to the national reform of the Vocational Education Training system and to the building of a modern, competency based and labor market oriented Vocational Education Training system, with focus on practical training.

agencyname: Swiss Agency for Development and Co-operation
projecttitle: Water Management Skills Development in Uzbekistan
project_descrip: Short: WATER MANAGEMENT SKILLS DEVELOPMENT IN UZBEKISTAN Long: The fourth Phase of the Skills Development Project (SDP) in Uzbekistan contributes to the improvement and further development of the Vocational Education and Training (VET) system by introducing and strengthening the systemic approach to cooperation among stakeholders in the water sector within the cycle  Demand-Training-Job Placement . The systemic approach to be followed in this Phase of SDP is going to serve as a blueprint for other sectors of the economy and be replicated accordingly.

agencyname: Swiss Agency for Development and Co-operation
projecttitle: More coffee with less water - towards a reduction of the blue water footprint in coffee production
project_descrip: Short: MORE COFFEE WITH LESS WATER - TOWARDS A REDUCTION OF THE BLUE WATER FOOTPRINT IN COFFEE PRODUCTION Long: Growing coffee consumes vast quantities of water. In Vietnam, there are sometimes water shortages in the villages surrounding the plantations. The SDC is working with the Vietnamese authorities and food company Nestlé to encourage local coffee growers to optimise their water use.
shortdescription: MORE COFFEE WITH LESS WATER - TOWARDS A REDUCTION OF THE BLUE WATER FOOTPRINT IN COFFEE PRODUCTION
longdescription: Growing coffee consumes vast quantities of water. In Vietnam, there are sometimes water shortages in the villages surrounding the plantations. The SDC is working with the Vietnamese authorities and food company Nestlé to encourage local coffee growers to optimise their water use.

shortdescription: MORE COFFEE WITH LESS WATER - TOWARDS A REDUCTION OF THE BLUE WATER FOOTPRINT IN COFFEE PRODUCTION
longdescription: Growing coffee consumes vast quantities of water. In Vietnam, there are sometimes water shortages in the villages surrounding the plantations. The SDC is working with the Vietnamese authorities and food company Nestlé to encourage local coffee growers to optimise their water use.

agencyname: Swiss Agency for Development and Co-operation
projecttitle: More coffee with less water - towards a reduction of the blue water footprint in coffee production
project_descrip: Short: MORE COFFEE WITH LESS WATER - TOWARDS A REDUCTION OF THE BLUE WATER FOOTPRINT IN COFFEE PRODUCTION Long: Intensified coffee production in Vietnam, the world's second largest coffee producer, has resulted in seasonal water scarcity due to over-irrigation and water mismanagement. In this project Nestlé and SDC partner up to support achieving sufficient water availability for all water users in Vietnam. The project showcases that saving water is both, sustainable and profitable, for small scale coffee farmers. An aspect featured in global outreach and policy dialogues as well as in Switzerland as the world's trading hub for coffee.
shortdescription: MORE COFFEE WITH LESS WATER - TOWARDS A REDUCTION OF THE BLUE WATER FOOTPRINT IN COFFEE PRODUCTION
purposename: Water sector policy and administrative management
longdescription: Intensified coffee production in Vietnam, the world's second largest coffee producer, has resulted in seasonal water scarcity due to over-irrigation and water mismanagement. In this project Nestlé and SDC partner up to support achieving sufficient water availability for all water users in Vietnam. The project showcases that saving water is both, sustainable and profitable, for small scale coffee farmers. An aspect featured in global outreach and policy dialogues as well as in Switzerland as the world's trading hub for coffee.

agencyname: Cantons and municipalities
projecttitle: Écologie et agriculture dans le sud-est aride du Zimbabwe : Centre de formation portuaire à Chaseyama
project_descrip: Short: ÉCOLOGIE ET AGRICULTURE DANS LE SUD-EST ARIDE DU ZIMBABWE : CENTRE DE FORMATION PORTUAIRE À CHASEYAMA Long: La mauvaise situation économique persistante et les périodes récurrentes de sécheresse menacent le développement positif de l'est du Zimbabwe. Le groupe cible et les contributeurs à ce projet sont les petits agriculteurs d'une zone agricole défavorisée et dégradée dans les basses terres des districts de Chimanimani et de Chipinge, dans la province du Manicaland. Ici, le centre de formation doit être agrandi. En outre, l'approvisionnement en eau doit être assuré par un point d'eau solaire, des logements pour les participants à la formation doivent être construits et l'extension de la pépinière doit être réalisée. Le montant demandé sera utilisé pour payer la prochaine période budgétaire, pour poursuivre la formation sur les méthodes de culture et pour élargir les connaissances des participants.
shortdescription: ÉCOLOGIE ET AGRICULTURE DANS LE SUD-EST ARIDE DU ZIMBABWE : CENTRE DE FORMATION PORTUAIRE À CHASEYAMA
longdescription: La mauvaise situation économique persistante et les périodes récurrentes de sécheresse menacent le développement positif de l'est du Zimbabwe. Le groupe cible et les contributeurs à ce projet sont les petits agriculteurs d'une zone agricole défavorisée et dégradée dans les basses terres des districts de Chimanimani et de Chipinge, dans la province du Manicaland. Ici, le centre de formation doit être agrandi. En outre, l'approvisionnement en eau doit être assuré par un point d'eau solaire, des logements pour les participants à la formation doivent être construits et l'extension de la pépinière doit être réalisée. Le montant demandé sera utilisé pour payer la prochaine période budgétaire, pour poursuivre la formation sur les méthodes de culture et pour élargir les connaissances des participants.

agencyname: Swiss Agency for Development and Co-operation
project_descrip: Short: SMALL IRRIGATION SCHEME Long: Overall goal is to enjoy food security in rural communities in dry areas from Masvingo & Manicaland Provinces by 2020, enhancing livelihoods, income and nutrition of rural households. Outcome: (1) Enabling environment is in place to allow increased productivity and income for the smallholders in terms of water, energy, legal, fiscal, land tenure framework etc.(institutional and environmental (framework conditions) Indicator: Number of people ready to invest their time in rehabilitation. (2) Target groups manage irrigation systems in a sustainable way, utilize inputs (adapted seeds in particular) and apply recommended technical advice on agriculture, nutrition and HIV/AIDS to improve livelihood and income. Indicator: Reduction of proportion of beneficiary households failing to meet food requirements from own production. (3) Agricultural productivity is improved, conditions are established to allow smallholders to produce for the market, and linkages to the markets are promoted: Indicator: Economic status of targeted population increased by 20% in 10 year time.

agencyname: Swiss Agency for Development and Co-operation
project_descrip: Short: REHABILITATION OF SMALL IRRIGATION SCHEMES Long: The project aims at improving income, food and nutrition security of smallholder farmers in Zimbabwe. This will be done through the rehabilitation of small-scale irrigation schemes[1] and linking them to viable markets. SDC will contribute to a programme developed and coordinated by FAO and the Government of Zimbabwe, and will focus its support to the Masvingo Province which lies in the dry and arid region of the country. [1] For the purposes of this programme, small irrigation schemes are defined as communal schemes with irrigators having an average plot size of 0.5ha to 1.0 ha with a common water source and conveyance system and an area of 50 – 100 ha i.e. benefiting an average of 100 – 200 irrigators.
